results.title: The Ape that stood up
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Horizon”.
Traces the evolution of man, and his split from the apes to the development of modern man. Shows archaeological discoveries which helped to revise our ideas about the human line of descent. Includes research done by Lewis & Mary Leakey. No other credits available.

results.title: Aorere: an attempt at change
results.creator_credit: Department of Education, New Zealand and Zero Sixteen Films
results.brief_description: The headmaster of Aorere College in South Auckland, New Zealand, believes that the resources of secondary schools should be used more completely. Shows the ways in which other members of the community share the facilities of Aorere College.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Department of Education, New Zealand and Zero Sixteen Films

results.title: Anzac: a nation's heritage
results.creator_credit: Don Murray, Frank Bagnall, Australian Commonwealth Film Unit, Denys Brown and Lee Robinson
results.brief_description: A commemoration of the 50th anniversary of the landing by Australian and New Zealand troops on the Gallipoli Peninsula. Highlights include memorial services in Australia, New Zealand and Britain, a re-enactment at Anzac cove and scenes of Gallipoli and Troy today.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Don Murray, Frank Bagnall, Australian Commonwealth Film Unit, Denys Brown and Lee Robinson

results.title: Anzac
results.creator_credit: Jennie Blackwood, Adrian Boddington and Zanthus Films
results.brief_description: Historical photographs and early newsreels tell the story of the Gallipoli assault; embarkation and transport of 75,000 men in 200 ships from Egypt to Gallipoli; initial landing below cliffs; building a jetty and digging in; main British attack at Cape Helles and subsequent assaults on the heights; hardships, casualties and final evacuation. Commentary by Moray Powell and Peter Carver.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jennie Blackwood, Adrian Boddington and Zanthus Films
results.description: Historical photographs and early newsreels tell the story of the Gallipoli assault; embarkation and transport of 75,000 men in 200 ships from Egypt to Gallipoli; initial landing below cliffs; building a jetty and digging in; main British attack at Cape Helles and subsequent assaults on the heights; hardships, casualties and final evacuation. Commentary by Moray Powell and Peter Carver.

Commentary by Moray Powell and Peter Carver.

results.title: Anyway...what is an Australian?
results.creator_credit: Barbara Boyd and Victoria. Audio-Visual Education Centre
results.brief_description: Views the concept of multiculturalism through the eyes of several Australians in multicultural Melbourne. Through these people’s lives, the most typical element of Australian society is seen to be a continuing pattern of cultural interchange. A spectrum of ideas, attitudes and values which reflect the diversity of opinions, traditions and life-styles current among the Australian population. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: Any time, any place
results.brief_description: This documentary presented by the United States National Parks Service, expresses concern that man has become separate from nature. While many humans still exist as they did centuries ago, modern man has built a wall against nature. Calls for teaching to inspire and regain an interest in nature. Suitable for Upper Primary and Secondary level students.

results.title: Any friends or relations
results.brief_description: A tractor safety film which investigates the many kinds of accidents which can happen. Shows how the operator’s personal failures can cause accidents. Gives valuable safety hints on the operation of tractors. Suitable for rural and construction
results.description: A tractor safety film which investigates the many kinds of accidents which can happen. Shows how the operator’s personal failures can cause accidents. Gives valuable safety hints on the operation of tractors. Suitable for rural and construction

results.title: Ants
results.brief_description: Varied activities of four different types of ants; mound builders, black ants, household ants, and carpenter ants. Shows in detail the life cycle of the carpenter ant, including construction of the nest, laying of eggs, feeding of young , hatching, and preparations for swarming. Intercolony battle between mound builders and food ants.
results.description: Varied activities of four different types of ants; mound builders, black ants, household ants, and carpenter ants. results.title: Antonio
results.creator_credit: Tony Ianzelo, Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: The story of an Italian immigrant, a widower, living alone with his memories, his Bible, and Dante which he learned to read in English. He talks about his past, his children, of good times and bad. A warm portrait of an aging man who chooses freedom and independence even though it at times means solitude.

results.title: Anton Chekhov: a writer's life
results.brief_description: Uses photographs, contemporary footage, and excerpts from his writings to present a portrait of the Russian dramatist and short story writer, Anton Chekhov. Includes scenes from his plays and stories performed by artists from Moscow Art Theatre and the Mosfilm Studios.
